title: How to add applications on an iPod (2nd generation) - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: How do you add applications on an iPod (2nd generation)? A: You simply use the App Store and click on the app that you want. It will install itself. Yes, there are old versions of apps still in the app store, the store will figure out which version of iOS you are on and give you the app for that version.

You probably can’t. If you mean an iPod touch (other models couldn’t use apps), the 2nd generation model is 11 years old. It can’t run anything newer than iOS 4.2.1. It is highly unlikely that any apps in the App Store are still available to run natively on iOS 4.
